whatis.question: ¿What is the pomodore Technique?
whatis.whatis: The Pomodoro Technique is a time management method to increase your productivity.
whatis.how: A timer is used to divide the time into intervals called
whatis.grey: The duration of each interval depends on your level of focus but is usually 25 minutes for pomodoros and 5 minutes for breaks.

ask.title: Frequently asked questions

flip.title: How to use the Pomodoro Technique?
flip.infoone: In essence these are the steps but consider that times can change and the app helps you in the adoption process.
flip.flipone: Make a to-do list and get a timer.
flip.fliptwo: Set the timer for 20 or 25 minutes and focus on one task until the alarm goes off.
flip.flipthree: Upon completion of the session, check off a pomodoro and record what you completed.
flip.flipfour: Take a 5 minute break to refresh your concentration.
flip.flipfive: After 4 pomodoros, take a long 15-minute break.

fliptwo.title: What to do during pomodoro breaks?
fliptwo.infoone: Make sure they are activities that do not exhaust you mentally. Here are
fliptwo.flipthree: Listen to one of your favorite songs.
